result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick R Chatterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick R Chatterson

records.addlTxt:
2:34 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat recites agreement - defendant plea to count 1 - DRI count 2.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY to count 1.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant on count 1 and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court DRI count 2.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Abide with all rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay court costs.

Court adjourned at 2:41 p.m.
from Agent Paul Hyland dated December 9, 2014
Notice of hearing for Plea & Sentencing scheduled on 12/23/2014 at 2:00 p.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to Forward.
from Agent Paul Hyland dated December 2, 2014
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

1:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, will be meeting next week to review discovery.  Court will set for plea & sentencing in 60 days.

Court adjourned at 1:49 p.m.
State's
Return date on November 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
By Atty Barbara Privat
Status hearing on October 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

2:03 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joseph Riepenhoff.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Rieppenhoff, defendant will be waiving the preliminary hearing.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

Statement by Atty Rieppenhoff, defendant qualifies for PD representation and counsel will be appointed.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Rieppenhoff and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Rieppenhoff enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status of counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 2:06 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Laura P. at GLSO.
43

1:03 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail and without an attorney.

Defendant confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  

Court orders bond set at $500.00 signature bond.  

Court quashes the warrant.

Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing and it's time limits.  Defendant requests a preliminary hearing.  Court states preliminary hearing will be held within the next twenty days.

Court instructs defendant on how to retain an attorney.

Court adjourned at 1:08 p.m.

Warrant sent down to GLSO on 09/02/2014.
43
Warrant letter sent to the defendant.  Respond on or before July 7, 2014 or warrant will be issued.

9:26 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Special Prosecutor Chuck Stertz for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant, stayed for ten days.

Court adjourned at 9:26 a.m.
